title: House Judiciary Committee plans contempt of Congress proceedings for Mark Zuckerberg
description: The Republican-led committee says Zuckerberg and Meta “willfully refused” to comply in full with a subpoena on content moderation by social media platforms.

title: Special counsel examines 2020 meeting where Trump was briefed on U.S. election system's integrity
description: At least two more "fake electors" have also been subpoenaed by the grand jury probing efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.

title: Judge rules against Biden immigration policy, calling it 'invalid'
description: A federal judge dealt a major blow to President Biden’s immigration policy Tuesday, calling a rule that limits who can apply for asylum at the border “invalid.”

title: New Biden rule would make government websites and apps more accessible to people with disabilities
description: Some of the changes could include providing text descriptions for photos for the visually impaired who use screen readers, and captioning for government videos.

title: Elderly drug dealer in overdose death of actor Michael K. Williams sentenced to two-and-a-half years in prison
description: An elderly drug dealer was sentenced on Tuesday to 2 and a half years in prison in connection with the overdose death of actor Michael K. Williams.

title: Bronny James' sudden cardiac arrest: What is it and how common is it?
description: After Bronny James’ cardiac arrest during a USC workout, here’s what you should know about sudden cardiac arrest, including symptoms and who’s at risk.

title: 'Massive amount' of evidence recovered from Gilgo Beach murder suspect's home as police end search
description: A "massive amount" of evidence was recovered at the "cluttered" home of Gilgo Beach murder suspect Rex Heuermann, authorities said Tuesday while announcing their nearly two-week-long search through the house was over.

title: Auschwitz Memorial criticizes Fox News' Greg Gutfeld for saying Jews survived Nazi camps by being 'useful'
description: The Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum criticized Fox News' Greg Gutfeld for saying that Jewish people survived concentration camps by being “useful.”

title: BBC apologizes for asking Morocco soccer captain if teammates are lesbians
description: British broadcaster BBC apologized after one of its reporters asked the captain of Morocco’s Women’s World Cup team if any of her soccer teammates are lesbians.

title: Like a hot tub: Water temperatures off Florida soar over 100 degrees, stunning experts
description: On Monday, as much of the country stewed in bubbling heat, a boiling milestone was hit — a buoy in Florida registered a jaw-dropping 101.1 degrees Fahrenheit water temperature.

title: UPS workers reach a tentative contract deal with management days ahead of strike deadline
description: UPS and the Teamsters union reached a tentative agreement for a new five-year contract covering 340,000 workers at the nation’s largest package carrier, six days before a threatened strike that risked snarling deliveries.

title: San Francisco police shut down removal of Twitter HQ sign
description: Elon Musk's Twitter hit a stumbling block in its rebranding to "X" when police shut down the removal of the company's former bird logo sign outside its San Francisco headquarters. KNTV's Velena Jones reports.

title: Bronny James in 'stable condition' after suffering cardiac arrest at basketball workout
description: Bronny James, son of basketball icon LeBron James, collapsed during a workout in Los Angeles Monday and was rushed to the hospital, the family said.

title: Ron DeSantis' team says he is uninjured after a car accident in Tennessee
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and his team were uninjured after they were involved in a car accident Tuesday in Tennessee, according to his presidential campaign.

title: Everything to know about Elon Musk's 'everything app'
description: Twitter’s rebrand to “X” is more than a name change. Musk has trumpeted the move as the biggest step yet in the transformation of what was once a humble microblogging app into an “everything app.”

title: Carlee Russell’s ex-boyfriend speaks out, condemning kidnapping hoax
description: Hours after a lawyer representing Carlee Russell revealed the 25-year-old Alabama woman was not kidnapped as she reported to police, her now-ex boyfriend posted a statement condemning her actions.

title: China removes Qin Gang as foreign minister, deepening mystery over senior diplomat's whereabouts
description: Chinese foreign minister Qin Gang has been removed from his post, state media reported Tuesday, deepening a mystery that began when the diplomat disappeared from public view.

title: Babies with eczema could go on to develop food allergies, asthma and hay fever - in that order
description: Allergies in kids often follow a predictable pattern, new research finds. The "allergic march" goes from eczema to food allergies and asthma to hay fever.

title: The rise of Vivek Ramaswamy: A long-shot candidate ascends in the GOP primary
description: Vivek Ramaswamy, the 37-year-old executive and self-described “anti-woke” crusader, has been rising in the polls, but his rivals say they aren't too worried.

title: Heat waves hitting U.S. and Europe 'virtually impossible' without climate change, researchers say
description: The heat waves simultaneously broiling the southwest United States and southern Europe would have been “virtually impossible” if not for climate change, according to a group of scientists who study the probability of extreme weather events.

title: Former Trump DOJ official Richard Donoghue has met with the special counsel's office
description: Donoghue served as acting deputy attorney general near the end of Trump's presidency and later testified before the House Jan. 6 committee.

title: A look back at Twitter ahead of rebrand to 'X'
description: Twitter owner and billionaire Elon Musk is officially rebranding the social media platform to be called “X.” Twitter CEO Linda Yaccarino said that “X is the future state of unlimited interactivity.”

title: Former pastor arrested in 1975 murder of young girl walking to his church
description: On. Aug. 15, 1975, 8-year-old Gretchen Harrington was walking to Bible camp in a township outside Philadelphia when she was kidnapped and murdered.
